fields.name: Artificial Intelligence and Data Science (AI & DS)
fields.description:
A specialized and emerging branch focusing on creating "smart" machines. You learn about machine learning, neural networks, big data analytics, and statistics to teach computers how to make decisions.

Best For: Students strong in mathematics/statistics who want to work on future-tech like Chatbots, Automation, and Predictive Analytics.

fields.name: Information Technology (IT)
fields.description:
Very similar to CSE but focuses more on the application and management of computer systems rather than the deep hardware/software theory. It deals heavily with networking, information security, and maintaining IT infrastructures for businesses.

Best For: Students interested in networking, system administration, and practical software solutions.

fields.name: Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
fields.description:
Focuses on the development of software, algorithms, and computing systems. It covers programming languages (like Python, Java, C++), operating systems, database management, and web development.

Best For: Students who love coding, logic, and building applications.

fields.name: Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE)
fields.description:
The bridge between hardware and software. It involves the study of microprocessors, satellite communication, signal processing, and designing electronic circuits (chips).

Best For: Students interested in how mobile phones, processors, and telecommunication systems work.

fields.name: Mechanical Engineering (ME)
fields.description:
One of the oldest branches, focusing on the design, manufacturing, and maintenance of mechanical systems. You study thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, robotics, and engine design.

Best For: Students who enjoy physics, mechanics, and understanding how machines and engines operate.

fields.name: Civil Engineering (CE)
fields.description:
Deals with the design, construction, and maintenance of the physical environment. This includes infrastructure like roads, bridges, dams, buildings, and water supply systems.

Best For: Students who want to work in construction, urban planning, or infrastructure development.

fields.name: Electrical Engineering (EE)
fields.description:
Focuses on the study of electricity, electromagnetism, and electronics. Unlike ECE (which deals with low-voltage signals), EE often deals with high-voltage power generation, transmission, motors, and transformers.

Best For: Students interested in power grids, renewable energy, and heavy electrical machinery.

fields.name: Chemical Engineering
fields.description: Involves converting raw materials into useful products (like fuel, plastic, medicine) through chemical processes. It combines chemistry with engineering principles to design large-scale manufacturing plants.

fields.name: Biotechnology
fields.description: A combination of biology and technology. It involves using living systems and organisms to develop or make products, such as vaccines, medicines, and genetic engineering.

fields.name: Aerospace / Aeronautical Engineering
fields.description: Specialized in the design and development of aircraft and spacecraft. Aeronautical focuses on flights within the atmosphere (airplanes), while Aerospace includes space travel (rockets/satellites).
